citations.narrative:
The registrant failed to notify USDA APHIS Animal Care within 10 days of a business change (facility address). Failure to
notify the agency of changes that affect the operating status of a carrier impedes APHIS Officials' ability to carry out their
duties. A registrant shall notify the Deputy Administrator by certified mail of any change in the name, address, or
ownership or other change in operations affecting its status as a carrier or intermediate handler, within 10 days after
making such change.
Correct by 05/05/2025.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 1:40pm on
04/23/2025. The inspector attempted to contact the registrant by announcing their presence at the facility address. The
tenant at the facility address stated they had moved in about a month ago and did not know the registrant. The inspector
then called the registrant at 1:42pm and left a voicemail. Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and records for
inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement action.
End Section

narrative:
2.27(a) 
   
Notification of change of operation. 
The registrant failed to notify USDA APHIS Animal Care within 10 days of a business change (facility address). Failure to 
notify the agency of changes that affect the operating status of a carrier impedes APHIS Officials' ability to carry out their 
duties. A registrant shall notify the Deputy Administrator by certified mail of any change in the name, address, or 
ownership or other change in operations affecting its status as a carrier or intermediate handler, within 10 days after 
making such change. 
 
Correct by 05/05/2025. 
2.126(b) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 1:40pm on 
04/23/2025. The inspector attempted to contact the registrant by announcing their presence at the facility address. The 
tenant at the facility address stated they had moved in about a month ago and did not know the registrant. The inspector 
then called the registrant at 1:42pm and left a voicemail. Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and records for 
inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement action. 
 
 
End Section
